title: Joko Widodo surprises with new Cabinet
text:
“There is also risk that legislative or even constitutional changes that fall outside the structural reform agenda could also slip through without meticulous scrutiny,” he wrote.

Aaron Connelly, research fellow in Southeast Asian Political Change and Foreign Policy at the International Institute for Strategic Studies in Singapore, said the Prabowo Subianto appointment could play out in various ways, noting the relationship had not in the past been “based on mutual trust or respect”.

“ I think it will make things within the Cabinet very tense," he said.

"Jokowi will be looking over his shoulder while Prabowo will be deeply suspicious that Jokowi will seek to undermine him.

"It is also possible that Prabowo, as a singularly prominent figure in Indonesia, will be able to attract greater investment in defence, which would be welcome," he said.

“The worst case is that Prabowo and Jokowi seek to actively undermine each other and create intense instability in the Cabinet between the two most influential figures in Indonesian politics, which is then resolved through extra-constitutional means," Mr Connelly said.

“The best-case scenario is that all the former generals in the Cabinet balance each other out and this allows business as usual to continue.

The omission of Tom Lembong, the former coordinating minister for the investment board - who did much to champion the Australia-Indonesia Free Trade Agreement - was a blow, according to Phil Turtle, President of the Australia Indonesia Business Council.

However, Bambang Brodjonegoro’s appointment as Minister for Research and Technology bode well for the relationship.

“Research and technology is an area that holds great promise for Australia, so having him in that role is very welcome,” Mr Turtle said.

As promised, Jokowi allocated 45 per cent of Cabinet positions to party officials or MPs and the remainder to outside professionals, some with links to the parties.

These include Nadiem Makarim, founder and chief executive of ride-hailing company Gojek, who has resigned from the start-up to join the Cabinet.

Andry Satrio Nugroho, researcher at the Jakarta-based Institute for Development of Economics and Finance, was not surprised at the level of party representation in the new economics team.

“The Minister of Economy and Mineral Resources is professional, but the Minister of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries is given to the party," he said.

"Likewise, the Minister of Industry from the Party, and the Minister of Trade from the party as well.

However, he was surprised maritime affairs and investment had been linked under the one co-ordinating Minister Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan.

Advertisement

“This is confusing. Who will coordinate the Investment Coordinating Board ?

"Will it be the Coordinating Minister for the Economy or the Maritime Ministry? Previously state owned enterprises came under the Maritime Ministry which made sense but not now it is connected to investment portfolio.”

Dr Ayla Aldjufrie, a businesswoman with several property ventures - mainly in Bali - hoped the new Cabinet would lift sentiment.

“Property is one of the cornerstones of our economy and growth has been sluggish in recent years due to the slowing economy and the impact of natural disasters,” she said.

Specific areas that needed addressing included foreign ownership of real estate and the Ministry of Tourism’s new Bali promotion.
description: The Indonesian president has begun his second, five-year term with some bold Cabinet appointments.
